intro: Zauschneria villosa, commonly known as the wooly larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Zauschneria villosa typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and woodland edges. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
